snippet: Lawmakers approved a $6.7 billion two-year budget on Tuesday, overriding the veto of the combative Republican governor, Paul LePage, and narrowly averting a government shutdown.
abstract: Maine lawmakers approve two-year $6.7 billion budget with enough votes to override veto of Republican Gov Paul LePage.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers approved a $6.7 billion two-year budget on Tuesday, overriding the veto of the combative Republican governor, Paul LePage, and narrowly averting a government shutdown.
